p: Many different chemical compounds have been tested in order to control the chalkbrood disease [ 10, 20, 21, 22], but no effective drugs against this fungal disease are currently available. When the colonies are infected, only a temporary reduction of symptoms has been achieved [ 22]. In fact, it is extremely difficult to eradicate this disease, because chemical products do not kill the spores, which are very persistent in the hive environment [ 11]. In addition, synthetic antifungal agents have several negative effects such as reductions in bee vitality in various life stages, an increase in resistance development and the contamination of hive products [ 23].
